text: WE’RE CLOSE ON THE FACE OF JAMES BRENNAN, 22. He’s gazing at someone off-screen, eye filled with longing. THERE’S NO SOUND. Behind him, OUT OF FOCUS, college kids a rollicking party...
Shouted, drunken conversation competes with a stereo blas “Bastards of Young” by The Replacements. A couple wear graduation mortarboards.
a pretty young woman, ARLENE. She’s avoiding James’s gaze They’re in a lived-in off-campus house. They hold cocktai in plastic cups. He leans in close.
Hey, you want to get out of here-
(hasn’t heard him) What a rager, huh?
Yeah. Yeah. (beat) Isn’t it weird? That this all...this happened right at the end of the semester? You and...me. She finally looks at him.
And we'll both be in Manhattan come September. (beat) I’m really...fond of you.
You’re sweet. (beat, thinking) James.
Yeah?
I don’t think I can see you anymore.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 2. 1
(stunned) You don’t...? What do you...?
We’re graduating...it’s... She sighs heavily and looks away. James watches her, wait for more of an explanation. Instead:
(muttering) sorry. She walks away.
James stands with two friends, ERIC (unkempt and shaggy- haired, yet radiates a casual air of privilege) and BRAD, who’s mixing a drink from the dregs of whatever liquor bottles he can find.
Women are mercurial, man.
You did just start dating last week.
I know, but...I thought that she got me...
You didn’t tell her about the ‘scarlet V'?
That has nothing...
You did. Brennan, you promised me!
Look, I don’t lie to people I care about.
But you could've just left it out of the narrative! You don’t want ‘virgin’ to be your signifier!
Jesus, he takes one semiotics class... Brad hands the ‘cocktail’ to James.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 3.
Drink up.
Listen. You need to bed down the next plain-looking, insecure depressive who throws herself at you and get it over with.
I’ve had ample opportunities to get laid, if I just wanted to get it over with-
Or a hooker. In New York, I hear the Asian ones are the best value.
Right, that was in Consumer Reports? Jesus. I know most people have low standards, but I’m different.
We’ll find you a girl. When we’re on the Continent. An OBNOXIOUS CLASSMATE joins their group, picking up all liquor bottles, looking for one that’s not empty.
So you guys are going to Europe? Even you, Brennan?
Yeah. My graduation present.
Forget about Arlene.
She dumped you? Ouch. Another one.
You've checked the Beefeater three times, Steve. All the bottles are empty.
James, focus on the trip. It’s going to be a transformative experience. Transformative.
The party has entered another phase. Brad sits in a circl of pot-smokers, passing around a pipe. Eric is making out with a girl. James stands alone, in a corner.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 4. 3
He sees Arlene across the room, holding court with her friends. She’s clearly talking about him. Humiliated, he skulks out of the room.

A newish, 80s-model sky blue Plymouth Reliant rolls down highway, James’s bicycle strapped to the roof. James is slumped against the window, sharing the back seat with so duffel bags and crates of records.
strip malls and chain stores... a high school, looking a little worse for the wear... suburban homes, varying only slightly from one another...
a young man on a bicycle. The back of his orange t-shirt reads:
As the car passes, we see the biker, a wiry, goofy-lookin year-old. His name is TOMMY FRIGO. Frigo recognizes James. He grins and gives him the finger
MUSIC STARTS: “EVERYBODY KNOWS THIS NOWHERE” by NEIL YOUN
The EQ on the Neil Young song changes -- IT’S PLAYING ON JAMES’S BOOMBOX. He sits in his bed, writing on a legal p

Cocktail hour in the Brennan household. COUNT BASIE swing on the stereo, as James’s father (MR. BRENNAN) is finishi off a frozen daiquiri, preparing another. MRS. BRENNAN si white wine, while reading a paperback copy of “Iacocca: A Autobiography”. James enters, clutching the legal pad, looking determined
Okay, so I need to talk to you guys about-  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 5.
Silence.
(putting down her book) Now what do you want for dinner? I can make a roast, burgers, minute steaks?
Wow. I, uh-
(crossing to the fridge) ...or leftover lamb stew.
Any of that sounds-—
And I even got that frozen manicotti, the kind you like.
He loves that.
Sure. Let’s have that. So...the trip is going to cost a tiny bit more than we discussed.
What are we talking about?

Um, my Europe trip? So my original estimate for the whole trip was 1,568 dollars. But I’ve researched more youth hostels and the median cost is a bit higher than I thought, by seven dollars and sixty-eight cents, multiplied by forty-two days is $322.56. But the good news is I still qualify for a student eurail pass, which saves us $143.45. But I also think my emergency fund is unrealistic at $100, I should make it $150. So, with the 768 dollars I have from grandma’s trust fund, plus the 800 you guys are already giving me, I will need another 229 dollars and eleven cents. It makes the total for you guys 1,029 dollars and eleven cents.
One-thousand and twenty-nine dollars.
And eleven cents. James's parents exchange a look.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 6.
James, your father has been transferred to a different department.
Really? That’s great-
It’s not a better department. We’1l be making less money. Considerably less.
Wh...what happened?
It’s not a big deal, they just, they reorganized a bit. It’s temporary.
We hope. I’m sorry, honey, I know we said we thought we could help with your trip. We can’t.
But it’s my graduation present.
I know, but we don’t have it. We can’t spare a penny for Europe. And we can’t spare a penny for grad school, either.
What? You were going to help me with rent?
James, we cancelled our week in Montauk. We can barely make the house payments. We’re clipping coupons.
Sorry, kiddo.
What am I gonna do?
If you decide you really want to go to graduate school, you'll commute from here.
But...Eric and I are getting an apartment in Manhattan...  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 7.
If you want to eventually move into the city, you better get a job.
A summer job?

Better start looking. Most of the good ones are grabbed up. Here. Mrs. Brennan hands James the classified ads. James stares the paper as if there’s a dead fish in it. Mr. Brennan starts the blender -- but he hasn’t affixed the lid prope The blender sprays daiquiri all over a cabinet.
Whoa, Nelly!
James, dorky in a button-down shirt and knit tie, stands front of a RESTAURANT MANAGER, handing him documents.

I really haven’t had many jobs, per se... But here’s my academic record and my extracurricular activities. I wrote for the literary journal, ‘The Gordian Knot’. And in high school, I got a 750 on the math SATs, so I'd be good at tabulating checks-
These are the only jobs you’ve had?
I also used to rake leaves for some neighbors, the Palmieri’s. I have their letter of recommendation-
(brusquely) Fill this out. I’11 call you if anything comes up.
James is mowing his parents’ lawn, a look of self-pity on face.
Tommy Frigo comes tearing down the street on his ten-spee He rolls up on the lawn, jumps off the bike and sprints a James, a crazed look in his eyes.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 8.
Nad attack! Frigo throws a punch at James’s groin. James manages to partially deflect the blow.
Frigo! Quit it! The two young men start swinging wildly at each other.
Watch out, the lawn mower! James turns for a second. Frigo wallops him directly in t privates. James falls to the lawn, moaning.
I’m going to fucking kill you, Frigo... Frigo hops back on his bike.
Ha-hah, Brennan! Don’t choke on your own goo!! Frigo pedals away, cackling maniacally. We see that he’s once again wearing his orange ‘Adventureland’ shirt.

James and Eric stroll down the sidewalk. Eric wears his “bohemian uniform”: painter’s pants, tie-dyed shirt, shel necklace and a kerchief over his head. James glances arou anxiously as Eric brazenly smokes a joint.
Home all summer. On Long Island. Fuckin’ harsh.
It’s a nightmare. I mean, I'ma romantic! I actually read poetry for pleasure. Out where I grew up, if I tell someone that, they’1ll beat me to death with a table leg.
You still thinking about graduate school?
Yeah.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 9.
Total mistake. What do you need another degree for? Did Henry Miller need a degree? Or Samuel Beckett?
Actually, Beckett went to Trinity College and after that he was an assistant for James Joyce. Which is a story I always wanted to turn into a two-character play-

Yeah, shut up, my point is -- you don’t come from money. Graduate school’s gonna require massive loans. Three more years of school, then, what, a decade or two of paying them off? Why not blow your brains out now?
But if something’s worth doing...

Take some time to picture the narrative of your life. Needing it or wanting money is the fundamental trap of humankind. (putting a hand on James's shoulder) Look, I want you to know you'll be with me in spirit this summer. Take this... From a coat pocket, Eric produces a baggie that contains several thin, poorly-rolled joints.
But, you know...I get a little crazy-
Take it. James nervously jams the bag into his pocket.
You think you don’t like weed. You will.
(worried, won’t drop it) But how am I going to break into journalism if I don’t go to grad school?
Brennan, you’ll be with me! In a few short months we’ll be in New York City. We’1ll be living the adventure together!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 10. 10 11 12 13
Mrs. Brennan reads a library copy of a biography of Pope Paul II. James sits across from her, hunched over the classifieds section, grunting as he reads.

What can I get?! I’m not even qualified for manual labor. (reading down column) carpenter...dishwasher...mechanic... septic waste removal -- they won’t even hire me. The only place I know I can get a job is where Frigo’s working.
Adventureland? You can do better. You have to try harder.
I’m ‘O' for twenty-two. I majored in comparative literature and Renaissance studies. Unless someone needs help restoring a fresco, I’m screwed!
TRACK WITH James on his bicycle, pedaling along with morn traffic.
James rolls into a large parking lot, passing under an ar sign that reads “ADVENTURELAND”. A gangly young man (RICH approaches him. He uses a yellow plastic wiffle ball bat direct traffic.
Right here, sir! Right here! Rich waves James toward a bicycle rack. Rich’s shirt read “Parking Captain”.
Have a funtastic day and come again!
Uh, okay. James, making eye contact, realizes that Rich is mentally challenged.
James stands with PAULETTE, 40s. Her badge reads “MANAGER  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 11.
I don’t have much work experience, per se- Paulette’s walkie-talkie emits a LOUD BEEP.
(into walkie) G’head.
Li’l Red’s down again.
Okay, there in a sec. (calling out) Bobby! Get over here! BOBBY, 40, moustache, bad tinted glasses, crosses over fr the snack bar counter. His badge: “JR. MANAGER”.
This kid’s applying for a games job.
Actually, I'd rather work rides if that’s-

Nah, you're a games type. Here’s the number one rule. No freebies. No free turns to your friends, no free upgrades, no free stuffed animals. Anyone wins a giant-ass pandas, you’re fired. Got it? Paulette hands Bobby some forms and exits.
Here, have a seat. They sit in a booth.
So what positions are presently open-

Games. You're hired. Fill this out. Bobby slides a start form across the table. As James star to fill it out, Bobby stares out the window, checking out some teenage girls in short shorts and tube tops. He sigh At a nearby booth, a kid starts puking on the table.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 12.

Geez. Kid, can’t you do that outside? (yelling) Doreen! We got a puker! 14 INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - DAY 14 We are greeted by a cacophony of pinball, skee ball, air hockey, Whac-a-Mole, Ms. Pac Man, Dig Dug, Zaxxon, etc. James now wears a light blue t-shirt -- stacked in descen size, it reads: “Games, Games, Games, Games”. He stands with JOEL SCHIFFMAN, 22, who has glasses, curly reddish-b hair and some scraggly chin growth.
Okay, let’s get this over with- Joel notices a bratty KID with a runny nose who’s slammin his fists down on the buttons of an old-fashioned “Bimbo Dancing Clown” machine.
Hey, retard. Stop pounding on Bimbo.
This game sucks. It doesn’t do nothin’.
It kicks your ass if you don’t get the fuck away from it. The kid scurries away. Joel smiles. The kid runs up to hi burly, mean-looking father.
Dad! (pointing at Joel) He said the f-word at me!
Fuuuck. Let’s go. Joel hustles James out the door.

Joel is marching James up the midway. We get our first go look at “Adventureland” -- it’s a ramshackle place, a lot closer to Coney Island than to Disney World. “Rock Me Amadeus” by Falco echoes across the park (top fo radio plays loudly all day long, every day).
F.Y.I., Paulette and Bobby are married, so watch what you say.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07)
JOEL (cont'd) And never walk directly below the “Sky Chopper”. The little animals are always spewing and dropping boogers on your head.
Brennan, you loser! James looks toward the “Antique Cars” ride and sees Frigo hanging out the side of a buggy car, driving it for two s children.
Ha-hahhhh! They put you on games, you pussy loser! Brennan’s a pussy! The children shriek as Frigo rear-ends another buggy car.
You know that demented person?

Yeah. He used to be my best friend. Then I turned four. 16 EXT. “LAUGHING CLOWN” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - LATER 16 Joel and James are at the ubiquitous carnival game wherei contestants squirt water into a plastic clown-head’s mout inflating a balloon until it pops.

The trick here: you’ve got a better chance of winning if you pick a clown with a new balloon. The old balloons have already been stretched out. Less likely to pop. You can share this info with cute girls at your discretion.
I appreciate that.

No sweat, new guy. 17 EXT. “HATS OFF TO LARRY” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - LATER This booth features an elaborate painted street scene. Revolving through doorways are creepy fiberglass dummies wearing black felt hats. Joel hits a button and the dummi stop moving.
The object is to try and knock the hat off the dummy with a softball. 13.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 14. 17 18 19
Joel tugs on one of the hats. It doesn’t budge.
Except half the hats are glued on. EXT. “THE FLIGHING DUTCHMAN!” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - LATE Joel and James are approaching another game booth.

This game is inexplicably called “The Flying Dutchman”. Even more inexplicable is how they decided to spell it. Morons. The sign reads: “THE FLIGHING DUTCHMAN!” They enter the game, which is a platform with forty or so large milk bottles. Very large stuffed panda bears are dangling over them.
One dollar buys five rings. If the ring lands on one of the red bottles, they win one of these giant-ass pandas.
That is a giant-ass panda.

It’s the best prize in the park. And that’s because this game is unwinnable. Observe. I'’11 drop the ring from three inches away. Joel holds a plastic ring right above a bottle. He drops The ring bounces off.
Nobody ever wins?

If they do, it’s because you weren’t being vigilant and they reached over and placed the ring on the bottle. Someone wins a giant-ass panda bear on your watch? Go home, you’re fired. EXT. “FREE THROW” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - LATER 19 They stand at a booth with five basketball hoops.
If you stand directly below a hoop you will see that it’s been hammered into an oval shape. But back here, the sucker can’t tell.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 15. 19 20
James passes a basketball through the narrow hoop.
It barely fits. That’s...so wrong.
A criminal abuse of the laws of perspective.
Well, people are getting ripped off-
Yeah, yeah, Trotsky, let’s get you a booth. (he walks away, James follows) So, your life must be utter shit or you wouldn’t be here.
Yeah. I want to be in Manhattan. But to make enough to cover rent and actually save anything seems so hard.

Wait til your parents start charging you rent. My dad even makes me pay utilities. EXT. “THE FLIGHING DUTCHMAN!” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - DUSK It’s the hour when the park starts getting overrun with teenagers and young adults. Blaring from the many loudspeakers is “Something About You” by Level 42. James's booth is getting crowded. A hyperactive guy in a faded MOLLY HATCHET T-SHIRT is demanding his attention:
Yo! Guy! How many rings for a ticket?
Five per ticket.
Give me five. How usually does someone win here?
Actually, I just started-
I heard that some big fat lady fell off the Paratrooper a couple of weeks ago.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 16.
Really? Was she okay?

I don’t know. Give me ten. No, give me fifteen. I heard she was a big, fat, really fat lady... James notices that the customer’s eyes are darting to something behind him. Just as James turns to look, he see DRUNK DAD (wearing a Scorpions concert tee) holding his s year-old child over the milk bottles. The boy places a ri on a red bottle and the man quickly pulls him back.
(slurring drunkenly) He won! Check it out! Look, my kid won! Check it out! Awright, Dom!
(lowering his voice) Sir, I saw you holding him over the bottles. That’s cheating.
What?! He won square-and-fair! Give him the prize!
I saw the kid throw it!
C'mon, guys, give me a break-

(for passersby to hear) This faggot’s trying to cheat a kid! Give the kid his prize! James glances over to a fellow employee in the adjoining booth, a pint-size, funny-looking 15-year-old, MUNCH (his nickname, short for “Munchkin”). He shrugs.
Guys, fellas, I could lose my job-

(leaning close) Give my kid the fuckin’ panda. The dad shows James a hunting knife he’s concealing by hi hip. Suddenly, a young woman in a “GAMES” t-shirt, EM LEWIN, enters from the other side. She pulls down a panda and gi it to the man.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 17.
Here you go.

Yeah, thank you. That faggot was trying to rip off a kid. The drunk dad stumbles off with his son, joined by the Mo Hatchet t-shirt guy, who snickers. James turns to Em. She cute -- no makeup, dark hair, pale skin, intelligent eyes
(anxious ) Am I gonna get in trouble? Nobody’s ever supposed to win a giant-ass panda?
Is it worth getting knifed over? I’m Em.
Hi. James.
Nice to meet you. Sucks you’re gonna get fired your first day.
(panicky) No, shit, I need this job-
Relax, man. I’m kidding. BEHIND THEM, Munch cups his hands over his mouth.
Yo, Connell!

MIKE CONNELL. He’s in his 30s, wears an ankle-length blac coat. His attractive features are framed by sunglasses an mass of unkempt hair. He carries a guitar case that’s emblazoned with the logo for a metal band: ANIMUS.
(flashing the “devil sign”)
Em watches Connell as he passes.
Who's that?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 18. 20 21 22 23 24 25

That’s Connell. One of the maintenance guys. As Connell continues through the park, employees hoot and rebel-yell to him.. INT. MANAGER’S OFFICE, ADVENTURELAND - NIGHT 21 James hands his ticket apron to Bobby. Frigo is punching out. A trashy-looking DRUNK WOMAN is slumped in a chair. Paulette talks into a loudspeaker microphone.
(reverberating across park) Ashley, your mother is looking for you. She’s waiting for you in the manager’s office, next to the snack bar.
Where is that little shit?!

James is riding his bicycle home. A Mercedes swerves clos as it passes, honking -- the occupants, rich teenagers, l at him. James scowls. Another car is rolling up beside him, a cinnamon-colored Pacer. Em is driving. They exchange a look... she drives off.
A glum James eats with his family.
Why don’t you call one of your old friends? Dave? Gerry?
And tell them I work as a carny? No thank you. Mrs. Brennan looks at her husband. He shrugs.

James once again pedaling his bike alongside heavy mornin traffic. And it’s raining. He looks miserable. EXT. “KENTUCKY DERBY” GAME, ADVENTURELAND - LATER 25 STILL A GRAY, RAINY DAY. To make matters worse, “Pac-Man Fever” by Buckner & Garcia plays over the PA.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 19. 25
James is manning the Kentucky Derby booth -- contestants each other by using a lever to flip a ball into a hole, w advances a mechanical horse.

(into a microphone, lackluster) Okay. And the race is on. He rings a bell and the contestants begin racing. He star absently off at a kid who is picking his nose and wiping snot on the booth wall. A bell goes off. JAMES (cont'd) And we, uh, have a winner. The blue horse. Yellow is second. Purple is third. Congratulations. As he gives a stuffed animal to the girl who won, James s Bobby walking quickly toward him, shaking his head.
James! Come on! I told you! You need to make it exciting!
Maybe, um, I’m not the right guy to run this game?
No. You do the job or you lose the job. You already lost me one giant-ass panda. C'mon, haven’t you ever seen a horse race?
Harness racing or the normal kind?
Who cares?! Just make it fun! Jesus. James nods. He collects tickets for the next race.

(attempting some enthusiasm) Okay, ladies and gentleman, put down your mint juleps and welcome to the Kentucky Derby! The horses are at the starting gate! Are you ready?! The contestants stare at him with blank expressions.
Okay. And they’re off! He rings the bell.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 20. 25 26

(building steam) And Red, uh, Red bolts out of the gate, taking an early lead! But look out! Here comes Green, issuing a challenge from the outside lane! Green runs well on a muddy track, folks, so today’s conditions give him a slight edge. And Yellow is dead last! What a disappointment after Yellow’s strong showing at Saratoga last spring. Wait a second! Out of nowhere, Orange has broken ahead of the pack! In the backstretch, it’s Orange and Green! Orange and Green! And Orange takes it by a nose! Green places and Red shows. Please come to the window to collect your winnings! Once more, the contestants stare at James with blank expressions.
What window?

Nothing. Forget it. Here you go. As James hands out a few crappy stuffed animals, he glanc across the midway, where Em is working in another booth. gives him a commiserative half-smile. EXT. “REMOTE CONTROL BOATS”, ADVENTURELAND - NEXT DAY 26 “These Dreams” by Heart plays on the loudspeaker AS WE CR DOWN TO James, on a bench, reading a Penguin paperback. H on a break. Behind him is a concrete pond where kids are operating radio-controlled miniature speedboats. PETE O'MALLEY (19, tall, athletic, freckled, red-haired I American) is walking by with a few buddies. They all wear “RIDES” t-shirts. Pete turns to James.
Hey, you're new, right?
Yeah. Started a few days ago.
Cool. What are you reading?
(hesitantly) It’s a Henry Miller book... ‘Quiet Days In Clichy’.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 21. 26 27 28
Pete nods, interested -- which pleasantly surprises James
He was an American author who lived a long time in Paris. It’s a wonderful novella about the bohemian life in France in the thirties.
Oh, yeah? Can I see?
Sure. Of course. Pete looks at the book for a moment, nodding...
he tosses it into the pond. His buddies double over in hysterics.
(grinning) Seeya, dork. The boys lope away. James, looking humiliated, watches hi floating book being attacked by remote-control boats.
James is prone on the couch, watching the classic prison movie “Cool Hand Luke” on TV. James nods in exaggerated empathy as Strother Martin breaks Paul Newman’s spirit...

EXT. “GOLD FISH BOWL” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - ANOTHER NIGH Over the park, Falco once again chants “Rock Me, Amadeus” James and Joel are working an unpopular booth. James is hunched over a legal pad and the New York Times classifie
I am amazed at how tiny my paychecks are. I mean, I’ve been working doubles.
Well, we are doing the work of pathetic, lazy morons.

I figured out that I’1l probably need three to four hundred a month for my share of the apartment. If I can save up twelve hundred dollars this summer, that’s three or four months of rent.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 22. 28 29

Sure. As long as you can eat for under thirty-seven cents a day. James, we’re both on the losing side of supply-side economics. My dad’s been laid off three times in the last couple of years. I got into Cornell, but the financial aid wasn’t enough. So it’s been state school for me. As they mull over their realities, a group of pretty teen girls walk by with their muscle-bound boyfriends.
All these pretty girls. Going out with troglodytes. This is the last place on Earth anyone would find me desirable.
You have a girlfriend at college?
I did. Then I didn’t. You?
The last girl I kissed was my tenth grade chem lab partner. She had braces. Fourteen stitches on my tongue. They stand for a moment, while we hear:
Amadeus, Amadeus...AMADEUS! Oh oh oh...Amadeus!
Jesus! They play this song, like, twenty fucking times a day.
Fucking sadists.
The park is closing. “Who’s Johnny” by El Debarge (the hi song from “Short Circuit”) plays as patrons exit. TRACK WITH James as he walks. He stops abruptly. He leans down to pick up:

that is no longer attached to a bicycle.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 30 EXT. “LOVE MACHINE” RIDE, ADVENTURELAND - MOMENTS LATE James, carrying the wheel, walks over to Frigo, who’s clo the ride down for the evening.
Frigo. Can I get a ride with you? Someone stole my bike. Well, three- quarters of it.
Ha-ah, Brennan! You’re such a nutsack!
Should I interpret that as a yes? Frigo moves behind a little booth, unzips his pants and starts pissing.
What are you doing, Frigo?
I can’t hold it. So lend me five bucks.
Why?
You want a ride home? James sighs as he reaches for his wallet.
James and Joel stand with a group of co-workers, includin Frigo and Munch. Joel takes a pipe out of his pocket. He stuffs it with tobacco and lights it.

(off of James’s look) I know it’s a revolting affectation, but it relaxes me. Em saunters over to them. She has changed into a concert for the punk band “The Damned”. She leans close to reveal that she has a PINT BOTTLE OF BACARDI in her coat pocket.
Want some?
Sure. Suddenly, the nearby co-workers scream loudly. 23. 30 31  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 24. 31
(in unison) Wet Fart! Wet Fart! Wet Fart!
No it wasn’t!
Check his undies!! James is at his breaking point:
I’m...I’m supposed to be in the Caravaggio room at the Uffizi or running with the bulls in Pamplona! Who swapped lives with me? How did I end up here?!
Welcome to the fucked. Cheers. Frigo turns his attention to James.
Hey, Brennan, did you know about Connell?!
What about him?
He once friggin’ jammed with Neil Young!
Seriously? SUE O'MALLEY, a tall, cute-ish, red-haired girl, pipes in SUE O’MALLEY It’s totally true! Connell is so friggin’ excellent!
...friggin’ major!
He played with Neil Young?! Tell me-
(interrupting) Brennan, did you know Connell’s got a rock band? They’re called ‘Enemas’.
(pointing at his t-shirt) It’s ‘Animus’, you moron. Uh-doy.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 25.
Shut up, Munch, you munchkin! I bet Connell gets tons of pussy!
He’s married, you perv! As this illuminating discussion continues, a rusty blue P pulls up beside them. Pete O’Malley, the jerk who threw James's book into the boat pond, leans his head out a win
Nice pipe, grandpa! Pete throws something out of the car. It nails Joel in th head.
Ow. I think that was a corn dog.

Sorry, Joel. My brother’s kind of a douche. An enormous puke-colored Cutlass Supreme pulls into the l In the driver’s seat is MRS. FRIGO, a squat Italian woman Rosary beads dangle from the rear-view mirror.
Brennan, you panty stain! Let’s go!
(sighing to Em) That’s my cue.
I can give you a lift.
Really? (turning) Hey, Frigo, I got a ride.
You got a ride?
Yes, I got a ride.
Why don’t you ride this? Frigo punches James in the groin. James crumples to the ground. Frigo cackles as he skitters away.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 31 32 33
What the hell was that?
(through the pain) It’s just my life.

head_text.subj: A CASSETTE IS PUSHED INTO A CAR STEREO

text: 31 32 The proto-punk classic “Roadrunner” by Jonathan Richman & Modern Lovers starts playing. Em and James her Pacer. She cranks the music up.
Em pulls up to the curb.
Well...thanks for the ride. James starts to get out of the car.
You in a hurry?
No. I’m...no. (awkward beat) are driving in 33 So, did Connell really jam with Neil Young?
Yeah, he did. At a club in the city. Connell’s actually really talented. Want some? She hands him the Bacardi. He glances toward the house.
(looking toward his house) Oh, Jesus. JAMES’S P.O.V. His mother squints at him through a window.
My mother. She’s very nosy. She read my journals. I had to start them in French. Okay, she’s gone. He slugs down some Bacardi. used to writing  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 27.
Joel told me that you’re going to grad school. Columbia? What for?
Journalism.
Oh, really?
I want to be, like, a travel essayist. Report on the real state of the world. Like, okay, Charles Dickens wrote what you might call ‘travel books’ -- but he visited prisons and mental asylums.
That’s cool.

Well, we don’t have to accept the world as it is. We can shine a light on, y'know, cruelty, disparity. We can say: I’m not settling for this crap. Things can be better. Em nods -- not entirely convinced, though.
You’re going into your senior year, right? What’s your major?
It'll probably be art history. It doesn’t matter. I mean, I can’t really picture myself in a profession. I don’t really like being part of...anything.
You’re a lone wolf.
Yeh. That’s me. 34 EXT. DANNY’S BAR, STRIP MALL - LATER 34 Em is driving alone. She slows down, looking over at DANNY'S, an undistinguished nightclub/bar. A back-lit sig (missing some letters) reads:
EM’S P.O.V. -- a green Plymouth Duster in the parking lot  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 28. 34 35 36 37
Em drives into the lot and parks. She crosses to the dive bar and enters. MUSIC: “Tops” by the Rolling Stones starts to play...

an unusually buxom and shapely 19-year-old woman. She has olive skin, flowing jet black hair and striking dark eyes She wears tight jeans and an orange “RIDES” shirt that is tied off to expose her midsection. She’s LISA P.

-.--Cause I'll take you to the top, baby...I swear we're never going to stop, baby...I'll take you to the top... VARIOUS MALES REACT TO HER -- a group of boy scouts ogle punch each other, a dad furtively checks her out, an awkw teen stumbles into a cotton candy cart. INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - CONTINUOUS 36 James works the arcade. Munch scurries up to a co-worker.
Lisa P.’s back!
(astonished)
(running toward James) Brennan! Lisa P.’s back!
Who's Lisa P.?
Holy mother of crap! Who’s Lisa P.?! James watches quizzically as Munch runs on to the next ma to pass along the news.
Lisa P. is holding court with several co-workers. Her presence has them electrified.
Joel behind the counter of the “milk can toss” booth. Jam stands outside the booth. They’re staring at Lisa P.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 29.
Look at the shape of her ass. It’s a Platonic ideal. That ass is a higher truth. Look, look! See how there’s that little portal of light just below her crotch. Where the thigh meets the pudendum.
Pudendum?
--.-I’m telling you, I’ve had dreams about that diamond-shaped portal... Shit, she’s coming over here! Be cool!
You’re telling me to be cool? As Lisa P.’s group breaks up, she saunters toward Joel an James, along with her friend, KELLY, a blonde girl. They' eating sno-cones. LISA P. Hey, Joel.

(nervously) Hey, Lisa. I didn’t expect to see you back. LISA P. Oh, man, I had my whole summer, like, Mapped out. Beach by day, dancing by night. But my dad, he got sick. He had this whole, like, heart operation. I mean, I need to help out, y’know?
I’m sorry to hear that. (apropos of nothing) My mom has shingles. LISA P. Oh.
So does anyone ever win this game?
The trick is to underhand it, with your palm toward you. It gives you backspin. LISA P. Yeah?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 30.
Then when the ball hits the lip of the milk can, it catches. Like this. James tosses a ball. It bounces off the lip of the milk c and doesn't go in.
(into a microphone, loudly) And we have a loser.
I mean, it takes a few tries. Ha. LISA P. Well, we gotta go run the ‘Love Machine’. Don’t want Paulette bitchin’ me out my first night back. (to James, with a little smile) I’m Lisa.
James. The boys watch as Lisa P. walk away. Joel looks like he might cry. 38 INT. “GAMES PALACE” ARCADE, ADVENTURELAND - LATER 38 James stands beside Joel as he plays a video game.

(narrating his play) Ah-ha! The smart bomb! Fuuuck! See, okay, yes, observe. I have two options. I could play it safe, cower back here and pick off marauders... (starts tapping buttons wildly) Or I could rush into the breach, guns blazing... Make a run right at the cortex!!
Your shields are almost gone...
.-.-And bombs away! An explosion sound -- Joel’s ‘strategy’ has succeeded.
Audentis Fortuna Iuvat. Fortune favors the bold. Virgil said that.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 31.

I’m sure Virgil had ‘Bionic Commando’ in mind. As Joel attacks the next level, James notices two burly, TOUGH TEENAGE BOYS playing a nearby video game. A sweet- looking, RUNTY BOY, is trying to watch.
Can I play?
Fuck off.
Can I have a quarter?
(ignoring him) Ah, shit! Eat fire-dick, sucka!!
But Dad said-
I said fuck off! The runty boy wanders off, pouting. James takes out his wallet, pulls out a few singles. He stuffs them into his change apron, counts out a bunch of quarters.
(to the kid) Hey, kid. Here, have some fun. James holds out his hand. The kid looks confused.

It's okay. Go nuts. The kid grins and takes the money. He runs back to his brother and shows him the quarters. The older boy looks o at James, suspicious and annoyed. He takes the quarters f the kid and pockets them. The runty boy looks stricken.
Fuck. (walking toward the kids) Hey, that money is his. The teenager turns toward James. He looks pissed.
What? Joel looks up from the game, surprised.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 32.
I...I just gave him that money. The teenager starts toward James, menacingly.
Are you accusing me?
(to himself) Fuuuck. The teen’s expression is borderline psychotic. People hav turned to watch -- INCLUDING EM, who has just entered fro the snack bar. James can see her, over the teen’s shoulde
(still moving forward) I’m gonna fucking beat you. You hear me? I’m gonna hurt you. Right now.
Okay. I can’t win a fight with you. I know that. (turning to Joel) If I have a seizure, get the syringe from my locker. It has insulin. If I don’t have the insulin, it could be fatal.
What? What the fuck?!
(turning back) I have a condition.
(confused and irritated) You have...you have...I...? (almost helpless) You fuckin’ pussy. He turns and walks away. Joel exhales, deeply relieved.
(aside to James) You made that up? I mean, we don’t have lockers...
What do you think?
Heh-heh! Brennan’s got a condition!!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 33. 38 39 40
James sees that Em has taken this all in. She gives hima sympathetic look.

MUSIC: Generation X’s punk rock cover of John Lennon’s “G Some Truth”. The camera is mounted to the “hood” of a bumper car and ZOOMING TOWARD James, a sitting duck in his bumper car. THE CAMERA IS JOLTED as James is sent spinning, sparks raining down. Em grins as she drives away from the scene the crime. James gives pursuit. He’s about to hit Em, when she veers the last second. James slams into a FRECKLED KID. The kid stares him down as he drives off. Em taunts James from afar, driving in circles. James catc up to her ... BUT THEN: the freckled kid is coming straig at him. They CRASH. James is thrown forward. A split- second later, he’s WHIPLASHED BACKWARD as another kid hit him. Then another. And another. Em laughs as every kid on the ride pummels James... EXT. “SHOOT OUT THE STAR” GAME - ANOTHER DAY 40 General Public’s “Tenderness” plays as three LOUD KIDS ar fighting over the BB gun.
C'mon, it’s my turn, fartstain!
No it’s not, dickweed!
(holding his head) That ride made me dizzy! Did that ride make you dizzy...?! James yawns. Beside him, Connell is repairing one of the guns.
So I heard that you jammed with Neil Young.
Don’t believe everything you hear. (beat) I’1l tell you about it some time.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07)
Where does your band play?
Usual places. But I need better players. I’m gonna start a new band. Out in Los Angeles.
Los Angeles?
It’s the best rock/metal scene in the world. Motley Crue, Poison, Ratt, Tesla. And punk, too. Black Flag, X, Circle Jerks... Shit’s happening out there. Goin’ this winter-
James turns to see that the ride-sick kid is vomiting. He turns and sprays puke right at James, who gets splashed before he can escape.
Bummer . James grabs a roll of brown paper towels and starts clean himself. Em walks over to the counter.
Party at my house tonight. My dad -- and his consort -- are in Martha's Vineyard.
I’m invited?
Yes, that’s why I’m telling you. Connell? Connell gives Em a long look. He smiles at her.

Sounds kick-ass. You kiddies have fun. Connell grabs his toolbox and walks off. 41 INT. DEN, LEWIN HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 4l Em, in a worn Buzzcocks t-shirt, is pouring Jack Daniels James’s glass. Behind them, a group of ten or so Adventureland employees, including Joel and Frigo, are drinking beer in the living room. Em’s house is noticeabl bigger and swankier than the Brennan home. 34.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 35. 4l 42 43 CONTINUED: 4l
Nice digs. I have to ask you... Why are you working at Adventureland?

I worked there a few summers during high school. I could’ve spent the summer with college friends. I don’t know...I was kinda sick of them. Adventureland sucks, but it gets me out of the house. James nods. She seems to be telling only part of the stor
Hey, I brought this. James reaches into his wallet. He removes a sad, misshape joint.

“Born To Lose” by Johnny Thunders is blasting on the ster THE CAMERA FOLLOWS the joint being passed around the tabl Sue takes a tentative puff, then passes it to Joel. He ta his ridiculous tobacco pipe out of his mouth to have a to before handing it to Frigo, who laughs maniacally while filling a giant cup with bourbon. Meanwhile, Em and James sit on the kitchen counter.
I’m going for a swim. Anyone want to join me? (nobody's going for it) Brennan?
I don’t have a bathing suit.
(shrugging) You're a guy. You don’t need to wear anything.
Em dives into the pool. She surfaces and looks up at Jame who stands shirtless, tentative about disrobing further.

Come on. James quickly slips off his jeans, leaving nothing but hi white cotton briefs. He’s not going any further. He jumps into the pool. After he emerges, Em swims up to him.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 36.
Hey, do you have any more of that pot?
Yeah, at home. Why?
My connections have all dried up. You ever make pot cookies? It’s really fun. Though last semester my friend Gary ate way too many and went nuts. Actually checked himself into a psych ward.
I’ve always wanted to have a psychotic break!

Don’t be a pussy! Em pushes James underwater. He re-emerges, grabbing her. She shrieks as he drags her under. They pop back up, laughing. They play fight for a few moments, then stop. They look like they’re getting arouse
I think I need a cocktail. Em gets out of the pool. James steals a glance at her bathing suit-clad body.
You coming?
(weirdly) Um. In asec. You go ahead.
(not sure why) Oh-kay. Em enters the house, James sheepishly gets out of the poo and “adjusts himself”.
Ah-hah! Frigo stands in the doorway to the kitchen.
Brennan’s got a boner!! Some of the others rush to the window. James panics and hurls himself back into the pool.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 37. 44

“Taking Tiger Mountain” by Brian Eno spins on the record player. From the kitchen we can hear the others playing a boisterous drinking game. Em, towel wrapped around her waist, enters with two cocktails. She hands one to James, who’s also in a towel. He’s flipping through her records.
Eno, Lou Reed, Replacements... Good stuff.
Here, give me your underwear. I'‘11 throw it in the dryer. James awkwardly slides his underwear off from beneath the towel. He hesitates before handing them over.
Don’t worry, you’ll get them back. As James sips his drink, he notices a gold-framed photo o dark-red-haired woman wearing a somewhat maniacal smile.
That’s my stepmother.
Oh.
My mother died two years ago.
(caught off guard) I’m...sorry.
My dad got remarried last year. (sneering at the photo) Her name is Francy. See that unholy abomination on her head? It’s a wig.
Really?

She had some kind of nervous breakdown when her first husband divorced her. Her hair fell out. I’d feel sorry for her if she wasn’t such a pathetic, status- obsessed witch. Em finishes her cocktail, cracking the ice in her teeth.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07)
I’m buzzed. Are you?
Kind of. She’s smiling a little. She leans over and kisses him. start to make out. Something out the window catches James’s eye It’s his mother. Mrs. Frigo stands behind her.
Christ!
What?
James Brennan, meet me at the door!
Frigo is taking a hit off James’s tiny joint.
(entering, confused) Frigo. Our moms are outside.
(coughing on the joint) Holy shit! If she smells marijuana on me, I’m dead! Frigo jumps up from the table.
Last time I got caught smoking weed, my father made me get into a bathtub filled with ice!
That was eighth grade-
I gotta get outta here!
(starting out of the room) Frigo. Come on. Act like an adult... Frigo suddenly jumps out an open window and scampers off the night. 38. 44 They 45 into  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 39. 45 46
Or not.
James opens the door. His mother and Mrs. Frigo are on th porch.
(sternly) What is this?
a thin joint. Em is watching from the foyer. Down the hal some of the others have gathered.
Eric...he liked to roll his own cigarettes. It must’ve gotten into my stuff when I packed-
Oh, this is a cigarette?
I think so...
Well, I found this cigarette on the floor of your room. Are you doing drugs?
No, I’m not doing them. I’m dealing them. Right out of the house. Cut open my mattress, you’ll find a kilo of hashish.
Oh, you’re some comedian. You’re a real David Brenner.

(stepping forward) Mom, couldn't this wait? I’m at a party. I’m not- As James moves toward his mother, his towel starts to fal off. James grabs it in a panic, spilling his cocktail all over the porch.
(clutching the towel) I’m not a child. I’m a grown man.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 40. 46 47
Is that so? Mrs. Brennan looks at Em, who holds a drink in one hand a James's wet underwear in the other.
Where’s Tommy?! He stole liquor!
He went with some of the guys to get pizza, Mrs. Frigo.
You better not be getting mixed up in any shenanigans, young man. Put on some pants. And underwear. HOLD ON the embarrassed James as his mother walks off.
Em’s Pacer rolls slowly down a dark road. Em drives, whil James leans out the window, squinting.
Frigo! You out there?! ... You idiot! -.. Frigo! He turns to Em and shrugs.
I can drive you home?

Okay. He turns away from her, embarrassed by his mother’s visit defeated. Em puts a cassette on. “There Is A Light That Never Goes Out” by The Smiths plays. After a few beats, James turns and glances at Em. She’s l in the song. Her hair is being tossed around by the wind. She’s beautiful. He turns back to the road.

head_text.subj: THE TREES SEEM TO BE FLOATING

text: as the headlights hit them on the twisting road. James looks back at Em. His anxiety seems to fall away...  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 4l. 48 INT. JAMES’S BEDROOM, BRENNAN HOUSE - LATER 48 James lies on his bed. He turns to his pillow, a goofy love-struck look on his face. He pulls it over his face.
(as if kissing Em)
As Em cleans up, the phone rings. She answers.
(familiar tone) Hey...No, they’re gone. Party broke up pretty early... (tentatively) Um, so... want to come over?

Em peers out a window beside the front door. HER P.O.V. -- pulling up to the curb is the same green Plymouth Duster we saw in the parking lot at Danny’s Bar. man gets out of the driver’s seat. It’s Connell.
Connell flips through the same stack of records James had been looking at earlier. Em enters with two Bourbons. She hands one to Connell.
So how long do we have? Five minutes?
A little more than that. But I don’t see any point in wasting time. Connell moves closer to her, sipping his drink.
Can I see some of your body?
Depends on what you want to see.
What do you want to show me? Beat. Em takes off her shirt. She stands before Connell i a light blue bra.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 42.
Oh, God. You’re beautiful. I wonder... Do your panties match? Em unbuttons her jeans. She slides them off. Her underwea is black.
They don’t. He moves close to her. Connell begins to kiss her neck. H arrives at her lips. They kiss for a moment.
Give me your hand. Do you feel what you've done to me?
(quietly) Indeed. Connell lifts Em up and puts her on the back of a couch. kisses her neck as he undoes his jeans. CLOSE ON EM’S FACE She wraps her arms around him as they begin to have sex.
James and Em are waiting on line. He hands her a cassette
I made you a tape. My favorite bummer songs. Truly miserable, pit-of-despair- type songs. You’ll love it.
Cool. Thanks. Two PREPPY GUYS in front of them on line are bickering:
.-.--Eat me! Pay for your own food!
Come on, just pay for me! Don’t be a Jew! You're such a Jew...
(piping in) Hey, I’m a Jew.
What?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 43. 52 53 54
I just wanted to warn you that my Jew germs are probably getting all over your sloppy joe here. I wouldn’t want you to catch Jew-berculosis.
(moving away) What’s your problem, freak? The two preppies hurry off.
What assholes. Em looks at James. She’s pissed, but likes that he’s take her side.
Em and James drive in her Pacer.
Where are you taking me? Em simply wags her eyebrows at him. She pulls into the parking lot of Danny’s Bar. The illuminated sign reads:
A DORKY TEENAGER screeches into a microphone:

(a la David Lee Roth) ---I ain't the worst you've seen...! Ah, can't you see what I mean?! Ah, might as well jump...JUMP! Go ahead an’ jump...JUMP!... WIDER -- a Van Halen tribute band comprised of adolescent They’re wearing sleeveless t-shirts and sweatbands. The bar is half-filled. Em and James are sitting at a tab in the back. They throw back Jack Daniels shots, followed Budweiser chasers.
I feel I should, um, tell you...
What?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 44,
(overly earnest) I, uh, had my heart broken recently. I just thought...I don’t know...I should tell you.
That sucks. Who broke your heart?
A girl at school. I really thought there was something there, that she and I had potential. I think she was afraid.
Afraid of what?
The real thing.
Ah. Was the sex good?
(evasively) She was very sexy.
Have you slept with a lot of girls?
Um. We’re talking about intercourse?
Uh...yeah.
Well, okay, um... There were a few times that I could've done that. But none of those times were quite right.
Wait. Brennan. Are you telling me that you're a virgin?

(defensively) There were circumstances. For instance, okay, junior year I dated this girl, Sue Hornick. Sue was kind of a prude. One day, I was reading some Shakespeare and realized -- I don’t really love this person...
.--Shakespeare told you that?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 45.

It was one of the sonnets. Y'know, about authentic love. I thought, this isn’t it, I have to break up. I went straight to Sue’s house and was literally about to tell her -- and that’s the night she said she finally wanted to have sex. Can you believe it? That was the night!
And you didn’t just fuck her anyway?
(as if this hadn’t occurred to him) Um. Well. No. (looking down) So what about you? And intercourse?
Could you stop using the word ‘intercourse’? You sound like my sex ed teacher, Mr. Pincus. My first was a guy in high school. (vaguely) And I saw some guys at college.
Were you in love with any of them?
Hell, no. They were all dicks.
Dicks. Gotcha. (something catches his eye) Oh, hey. It’s Connell. Em turns around. Connell is walking right toward her, accompanied by a pretty woman with long, tawny hair.
Hey, Connell! Connell stops short when he sees Em.
Do you know this place?
Yeah. This is my joint. Connell turns to the long-haired woman.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 46.
These guys work at the park. (turning back) This is Ronnie.
(tersely) Hey.
We’re meeting some friends. Connell leads his wife away.
Is that Connell’s wife? She’s good looking.
(irritated) Yeh.

head_text.subj: A CABLE IS PLUGGED INTO AN ELECTRIC GUITAR

text: TILT UP TO REVEAL that Connell holds the guitar. He has joined the band onstage. Nearby, a rowdy group are clappi and hooting -- all except Connell’s wife, who yawns and checks her watch. The drummer starts a propulsive beat. Connell winks at hi wife, then starts shredding, Eddie Van Halen-style. His friends go berserk. Connell shoots a look over at James and Em. He looks a little irritated... 56 EXT. DANNY’S BAR - LATER 56 James follows Em out of the bar.
Are you sure you want to go?
Yes. I don’t need to hear the entire Van Halen oeuvre. They cross to her car.
I don’t want the night to be over. Let’s go somewhere. Em hesitates. She nods, then gets into her car.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 47. 57 58

Em and James, on a beach, drinking cans of beer, tossing driftwood onto a fire. Em presses down the play button on an old-school cassette player/recorder. Through the plastic door we see, hand- written on the cassette: J’S FAVORITE BUMMER SONGS. A sta solo acoustic version of Neil Young’s “Cowgirl In The San starts to play... LATER: Em and James are lying on a blanket, staring at th night sky. Em suddenly stands and walks away. James looks up, bemused. He gets up, follows her as she enters a near wooded area. She glances back, then goes into a run. The Neil Young song slowly grows less tinny, more intimat James enters the dark tree area. He glances around for Em who’s disappeared. He looks a bit spooked.
crosses Em’s face, as she emerges from the dark. She push James into a tree, moving her lips to his. They kiss and grope, hungry and breathless.

EXT. “LAUGHING CLOWN” BOOTH, ADVENTURELAND - DAY 58 Once again, “Rock Me, Amadeus” is blasting. James mans th booth, trapped beneath a loudspeaker. Connell is in the booth, repairing one of the mechanical clown heads.
Do you have an ice pick I can jam into my ears? I can’t listen to this song again!
No, but I have this. Connell opens his tool box and tosses James a can of beer
Be cool with that. So, were you on a date the other night? James ducks under the counter to drink some of the beer.
Um. I wouldn't call it a date.
Not into Em?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 48. 58 59
No, she’s great. But I’m not really looking for a girlfriend. I’m getting over a broken heart.
You didn’t tell her that, did you?
Um, why?
(rolling his eyes) Christ. Girls don’t want to hear about your broken heart.
Wh-why not?
Because women don’t want a guy who’s all confused and torn up over someone else. Look, I’m not saying you should never be vulnerable in front of a girl. But you don’t play that card first.
It’s a card? Like a...card?
There’s a science to it all. You should like that, I bet you’re good at science.

James and Em are in a ferris wheel gondola, making out. T rise above the park’s twinkling lights. Springsteen’s “I’ On Fire” plays. James slides his hand up Em’s shirt. He struggles with her bra... THERE’S A LOUD SCREECH and the ferris wheel jerks to a ha

(into a bullhorn, singing the billy squier song) Stroke me, stroke me! Employees are staring up at the couple -- INCLUDING JOEL. Frigo starts up the ferris wheel... and then stops it aga Other customers on the ride start yelling down at him.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 49,
Frigo! Cut it out!
Sorry! I won’t do it again! Frigo starts the ride...and stops.
Last time! I swear! He does it again, cracking himself up...
Bobby sits with two exhausted-looking TEENS who are blood and bruised, noses and eyes swollen.

Guys. You can’t just come to a family amusement center and beat the shit out of each other. And you’re both wasted. Who can I call to come pick you up? C’mon. Em and James enter and begin to punch out...
(to his friend) Um...can your mom hear the phone ring... when she’s being gangbanged? The other teen lunges and suddenly the two dudes are beat the shit out of each other again.
(couldn’t care less about the fight) I have to run to the rest room.
I’1l wait for you in the arcade. They exit as Bobby struggles to pry the two kids apart.
Em exits the ladies room. Connell is waiting for her.
(quietly) I want to see you. Tonight.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 50. 61 62 63 64 65
Really?

I just miss you. Have I lost you? He’s looking at her with genuine vulnerability. Em seems affected by this. She looks into the arcade where James a Joel are playing a video game together, shoving each othe acting like kids.
Where can we go? That’s not the backseat of your car.
Meet me at Crazy Benny’s. Em walks away from Connell. Through the glass, we see her approach James.

Hey, let’s go. I can give you a lift, but I’m too beat to hit the diner... EXT. CRAZY BENNY’S LIQUOR STORE - NIGHT 62 Connell’s Duster sits in the parking lot of a discount li store. Em’s Pacer pulls in. She drives right up to his driver’s side window.
Follow me. He pulls away. She does a u-turn and follows...

EXT. SUBURBAN STREETS/CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - LATER 63 WE’RE WITH Em, in her car, as she follows Connell’s Duste down a tree-lined street. Connell pulls over and Em does same. Without speaking, Em follows Connell toward an older-look home. They walk around to a side yard... EXT. BACKYARD, CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 64 Em watches as Connell unlocks the back door... INT. DEN, CONNELL’S MOTHER’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 65 CONNELL’S MOTHER sleeps on a couch, under a crochet blank She’s conspicuously overweight. The TV plays loudly.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 51.
Hey, ma, it’s me... She awakens. CONNELL’S MOTHER (feeble, sickly) Mikey...? That you...? It’s so late...

(entering) You know me. I’11 keep it down. He gives her a kiss on the cheek. CONNELL’S MOTHER Okay, honey... 66 EXT. I don’t know...if she...I don’t know what I would... Connell, at a complete loss, walks away.
James approaches Lisa P., who’s taking tickets. Kelly is on the ride platform, locking people into their seats.

(distressed) Lisa, I don’t know what to say... But everyone's talking about Em and Connell. LISA P. Kelly has such a big f-ing mouth. (softer, contritely) I’m sorry ‘cause I gave you my word.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 104.
LISA P. (cont'd) We were so wasted that night. I can’t hide nothing from Kell. She moves closer to James, puts on a kittenish look. LISA P. Are you mad at me?
It’s just...Connell’s freaked out...Em quit... LISA P. I feel bad about Connell. I have a hard time feeling sorry for Em. James gives her a quizzical look. LISA P. Guys can’t help themselves.
But he’s the married one. LISA P. Yeah! Em’s a friggin’ homewrecker! James is amazed at this attitude.
But he was cheating on his wife. LISA P. I can’t believe you're defending her!
Cause, what? Guys can be shitty, but women can’t? LISA P. ("you're a freak” look) Whoa. Lisa P. shakes her head as she turns and walks over to Ke who’s been watching from the ride controls.

head_text.subj: A NEW SONG COMES OVER THE LOUDSPEAKERS

text: “Rock Me Amadeus” (of course). Lisa P. and Kelly squeal a begin to dance together.
(singing along) Amadeus, Amadeus...AMADEUS! Amadeus, Amadeus...AMADEUS! Oh oh oh, Amadeus!!!  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 105. 148 149 150 151

James watches them for a beat. He turns and walks away. EXT. “SHOOT OUT THE STAR” GAME - THAT NIGHT 149 As James collects tickets from some kids, he notices a co walking up the midway. It’s Connell and his wife. Ronnie carries their son.
She’s animated and upbeat, doing all the talking. As she focuses on the baby, Connell and James make momentary eye contact. We see how he’s trying to hide his anxiety.
Take Mikey. I gotta pee. Ronnie hands Connell the baby, then kisses him. As she exits, he breathes a sigh of relief.
Ronnie enters a stall and closes the door. She sits down the toilet.
Underneath, someone else has written
Ronnie stares at the graffiti. She knows it must be true.
As they eat dinner, James’s parents watch a small black a white TV news report on the continuing Iran-Contra hearin
Hey, dad, can I borrow the car tonight? Going to see a movie with Joel.
(looking at tv) Sure. Do you think he knew they were doing all that? Reagan is on the TV screen.
They should leave Ronnie alone. As if his job isn’t hard enough.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 106. 152 153 154 155 156
James drives. On the radio -- some rock deejay’s moronic patter. James snaps it off. EXT. DANNY’S BAR - NIGHT 153 James pulls into the parking lot. The sign reads:

INT. DANNY’S BAR - NIGHT 154 James drops quarters into the jukebox and chooses a song. Neil Young’s feedback-heavy “Hey, Hey, My, My (Into The Black)” starts to play. James sits at the bar and knocks back the last gulp of a bourbon-on-the-rocks.
(motioning to the bartender) Another, please.
Em’s Pacer is pulled off the road. Em stares out at the water, zombie-like.
Em enters the house. As she passes the living room, a few extra faces turn toward her. Her dad and Francy are entertaining two other couples.
Emily. You know the Waldsteins and the Ostrows. Em nods slightly. She walks over to the sideboard and pou herself a Scotch. Francy gives Mr. Lewin an incensed look
(to fill the awkward moment) Oh, Francy, I love the new pieces. The lamps! And that wonderful sideboard in the foyer!
I can’t believe you noticed!
Oh, really? I thought the house was a lot nicer the way my mom used to have it.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 107.
EM (cont'd) This? (indicating the decor) Pretty barfarific, if you ask me. Stunned silence.
Emily, you can’t say things like that.

(trembling) That’s right. I can’t say what I’m thinking and feeling every fucking day! Tears rushing to her eyes, she hurries out. 157 INT. KITCHEN, LEWIN HOUSE/CONNELL’S HOUSE - CONTINUOU Em enters, an irate Francy dogging her steps. Em turns around.
Do yourself a favor and leave me alone. Francy halts, tongue-tied. Em sips her Scotch.
You have no domain over me.

(exploding) Who the fuck do you think you are?! You think you can talk to me like that?! Ike!...It’s...Ike! Gimme that- NEIL YOUNG’S “HEY, HEY, MY, MY” FADES BACK IN, underscori Francy and Em scuffling. Francy grabs Em’s drink.
No-No-No!! You will do what I- Em suddenly reaches up and yanks on Francy’s wig. Francy shrieks. Em makes a getaway with the wig in her hand.
Em sprints up the stairs.
(losing it)
159 INT. EM’S BEDROOM, LEWIN HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 159 Em enters and locks the door.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 108. 159 160 161
Em. Open that door! Em pauses for a split second...
Em, I’m not kidding. This is .-.-I’m going to kill you, y unacceptable! Em, open the LITTLE FUCKING BITCH!!! door! Em tosses the wig out her open window. It sails into the pool.
The Neil Young song continues over the action as James stumbles out of the bar and toward his dad’s car.

James's father’s Reliant comes over a hill. It’s raining hard. As he winds through suburban neighborhoods, James reaches under the seat and pulls out his father’s hidden Cutty Sa bottle. He gulps from it. Tears sting his eyes.
speeds up. RATTLES LOUDLY over some bumps.
fly toward the headlights.

head_text.subj: SHRIEK AS HE WRENCHES THEM FROM THE COILED STRINGS...

text: James takes a corner too fast. The car begins to skid. He slams on the brakes and the car goes into a spin. It careens onto a lawn, clumps of dirt and grass flying i its wake. The car bumpily slides to a halt. No sound but rain thudd on the car roof. It takes James a moment to ascertain that he hasn’t hit anything, that he’s okay. He laughs bitterly. He slowly drives off the lawn. He rolls past a few houses and pulls into his driveway.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 109. 162 163
We’re looking up at Mrs. Brennan, who’s rapping on a wind
Rise and shine. REVERSE ON James, jolted awake. He has passed out in the front seat of the car. It’s morning.
Get out of the car. James opens the car door. He vomits on the driveway.
Jesus. James steps out of the car, looking miserable.

Come here. Mrs. Brennan leads James around to the other side of the He is surprised to see Mrs. Frigo standing there, a scowl her face. Mrs. Brennan points down -- there are large scrapes from the bumper to door. AND A SIZEABLE SHRUB IS JAMMED INTO THE CAR’S WHEEL WELL.
Care to explain how Mrs. Frigo’s hydrangea got here?
James sits at the kitchen table across from his parents.
So explain this, mister? Mrs. Brennan puts the bottle of Cutty Sark on the table. James looks at his father.
That’s...not...mine.
Ha! Don’t give me that! Mr. Brennan is frozen. James sighs -- he’s not going to l the cat out of the bag.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 110. 163 164

MRS. BRENNAN (CONT’D) What is wrong with you?! The drinking, that cigarette you claim wasn’t Marijuana. You’re acting like a juvenile delinquent. I think it’s that Adventureland. You’re quitting that job.
(quietly) I never want to go there again.
How much have you saved up?
One thousand, three hundred and twenty- two dollars. Give or take.
Well, that might cover the damage. You’re paying for Gloria’s shrub, too.
But...that’s my rent money. For New York City. Like, three months rent and the security deposit.
Not anymore. James looks inconsolable. His father sees an escape openi
I better check on those sprinklers! He hurries out of the room.
Another stifling, humid day. James is mowing the lawn, drenched with sweat, looking more despondent than ever. Mr. Brennan comes to the front door.
James! You have a call! James turns off the lawn mower
It’s that girl. Emily. As James enters, Mr. Brennan gives him a sheepish look.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 111. 165 166 167
Mrs. Brennan looks up from her library book as James ente He crosses to the phone receiver, which lies on a counter He stares at it, deliberating. James takes the receiver and hangs it up.
Good. She’s a troubled young lady. James looks at her quizzically.
Mrs. Frigo told me about her and the Married man. You don’t need a girl like that in your life. James takes this in.

location: MANHATTAN-BOUND LONG ISLAND RAIL ROAD TRAIN 166

text: James rides the train, listening to his Walkman. He wears oxford shirt, pressed black pants and dress shoes.
As James enters the Ivy League alumni club, Eric jumps up from an armchair. His hair is shorter, he wears a finely tailored suit.
(hugging James) James! Sit, sit.
How the hell are you?
(to waiter) Two Glenlivets, neat, please. (to James) I’m fine. Thoroughly fine. So you have a job interview?
It’s a training session, really. I'd work on a trial basis. Legal proofreading.
(doesn’t give a shit) Huh.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 112.
Tell me about Europe.
This trip changed me, Brennan.
Really? The waiter arrives with their Scotches. Eric takes a sip his, pausing dramatically.

It was revelatory. There I was, going from one incredible city to the next...the ruins, the cathedrals, the endless procession of art treasures...And I realized something. (beat) Screw the old world. I want the new world. And I want it now. Right now.
What? What do you mean?
I saw myself, five, six years from now, still dicking around, trying to ‘find myself’. But these are the years we can’t waste, Brennan. We’re young, we’re vital. Now’s my moment and I’m taking it.
Yes. Absolutely.
I’m going to Harvard Business.
You, what...? You’re applying?
I’m in. Strings were pulled, wheels greased, destiny’s been set in motion.
I’m...I’m surprised.

James, forget about the naive, utopian crap we used to talk about. The world has changed. It’s winner-take-all. The great minds, the great artists of our time are the entrepreneurs. Society's their canvas.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 113. 167 168

ERIC (cont'd) (leaning closer) You’re a smart guy, Brennan. If you remain passive, just bumble along like you always do, you'll be on the sidelines. You’1ll just be commenting on the people who are doing. Eric fixes a serious look on James for a beat -- then sit back and sips his Scotch. James is dumbstruck.
So, did you finally get laid this summer or what?

PAN ACROSS rows of cubicles, where people are hunched ove documents and computers. WE END ON a cubicle where James sits with a late 20s, out-of-shape, TIRED-LOOKING GUY. He showing James some legal documents.
If you have half a brain, the job’s easy. Unbearably, soul-crushingly dull. But easy.
How’s the night shift? I’1l have classes during the day.
The night shift is fucking awful. It’s a fucking stake through your brain. But after one a.m. pays double-time.
Double-time?

Why else would I do it? Okay... (sorting some papers) Fuck...It’s amazing how many of these fucking Ivy League grads can’t write a single coherent sentence. I read this stuff -- it’s like what a lunatic might write on an asylum wall with his turd. James laughs.
You sure you want this job?
Fuck it. Sure.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 114.
Okay. Fuck it. Let’s get started.
Mr. Brennan drives James home, swing music on the radio.
Overnight shift?
It pays double-time.
Your mother’s not going to like that. Beat. James turns to his father.
Do you have a problem with it?
(non-committal) Me? I...I might. I don’t...we’ll talk about it at home. His father turns up the radio. James turns the radio down
I’m taking the job, dad. I’ve made my decision.
But your mother...
She’1l live. James's father looks over at his son, surprised.
(warmly ) Okay, kiddo.
I need to stop by the park. I have to get my last paycheck. James turns the music back up.
Junior’s “Mama Used To Say” plays as James walks through park, avoiding eye contact with anyone. As he turns a corner, he overhears a familiar voice:  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 115. 170

-.-it was a little club. In Manhattan, in the Village... James comes around a game booth to find Connell standing front of a kiddie ride. He has the rapt attention of thre young women, 18-19 years old.

...The shows were always wild, people partied like crazy, we’d jam ‘til five in the morning. So, one of these nights, halfway through our last set, I’m noticing that everyone in the place keeps turning around, looking at this guy who just came in. He’s standing in the back with a couple of buddies. Then I realize it’s fucking Neil Young.
Holy shit.

I knew he was playing the Garden the next night. So Neil gives me a little friendly musician nod. We finish our song and some guy from their group comes up to me and asks, is it okay if Neil sits in for a few?
(all she can say) ---Holy shit! Holy shit!...

So Neil comes up on the stage. We shake hands. Just say hello and shit. Puts on a guitar. And we did a whole fucking set of his songs. We did ‘Southern Man’...‘Cinnamon Girl’...’‘My My, Hey Hey’... ‘Corvette Killer’...‘Like a Hurricane’...
(simultaneously) --.-Oh my God!...What a pisser!...Holy shit!... Connell grins. Then he notices James standing nearby.
Hey, I want to talk to you. (to the girls) Ladies, hold on a sec. Connell crosses to James. He lowers his voice.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 116.
You're fucking lucky. The whole thing’s blown over. Ronnie’s calmed down. Mostly.
Well. I’m glad... How’s Em? Do you know if she’s okay?
Em? She’s young and pretty, she comes from money. I think she’1l be okay. Beat. James gets an agitated look.
It’s Cortez the Killer.
What?

It’s not ‘Corvette Killer’. The Neil Young song is ‘Cortez the Killer’. Cortez. He was a Spanish conqueror. Overthrew the Aztecs. Connell looks tongue-tied. James turns and walks away, passing by Bobby, who is singing along with the music:
(mangling the lyrics) Mama used to say, take your tie off, man! Mama used to say, don’t you brush to get gold! Mama used to say- (sees James) Hey, Brennan!
Hi, Bobby. How are you?

Ah, you know, it’s Labor Day weekend. The season’s almost over... (really getting wistful) I always get kinda sad, y’know? I guess there's always gonna be that part of me that thinks of summer as this magical time, you know what I mean? Anyway, you're a good kid, Brennan. I hope it all works- a fair amount vomit comes pouring down on Bobby.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 117. 170 171
You’ve got to be shitting me. Bobby looks up at the “Sky Chopper” gondolas overhead.
Which one of you little shits...! (hurries off) This fucking place! What kind of fucking life is this...fuck...mother...goddamn...
Mr. Brennan's car rolls up to a traffic light and stops. James is looking out the window.
a rusty old Dodge Dart has just pulled over. And Joel is getting out of it, looking furtive, not wanting to be associated with his father and his battered car.
(to Mr. Brennan) Um. Wait for me at the corner. James hops out of the car. The Dart sputters away as Joel starts walking.
(jogging across the street) Hey! Joel! Joel turns around. He’s wearing his “games” shirt.
Oh. Hey.
You're back.
Yeah. Cash flow problems. (beat) I heard about all the shit that went down. Sorry.
Fucked up my dad’s car. Lost every cent I made this summer.
Well. We're both losers then. I better go, I’m late...  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 118. 171 172 173
Okay. (starts away then turns back) Hey. You should come to the city. To hang out.
Oh. Okay.
I’m serious. If you don’t come, I’1l come out here and drag you out of this place. Joel smiles.
Hopefully won’t come to that. I'’11 call you tomorrow.
Sounds good. Joel nods, then heads down the sidewalk, toward the park.
James stands in his backyard, taking in the evening.

echoes from a field behind his house. James sees a few bottle rockets shoot into the sky. He climbs over the fen and heads toward the group of young men shooting the fireworks. Frigo runs toward James:
Brennan! We stole a case of Schlitz from Zeblisky’s garage!!
Frigo runs around with a roman candle, pointing it like a rifle, as it shoots fireballs.

is tossed into a pile of cans. James, sitting under a tre opens another beer. He lies on the ground, staring up. He watches an errant bottle rocket ricochet into the branches above his head. WE MOVE IN CLOSE ON his pensive face. JAMES’S MEMORY. THERE IS NO SOUND.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 119.
WE’RE WATCHING EM, from James’s P.O.V., as she rides the roller coaster at Adventureland. She’s feigning boredom a the ride swoops and dips recklessly behind her.

- At Danny’s Bar, giving the camera a devilish look as sh throws back a shot of bourbon - A moment at a game booth, where Em turns away from an irritating customer and shoots us a “save me from this hell” look - Looking at James, sitting on the hood of her car, at th beach at night, her eyes filled with sadness and fear - Driving in her car, at dusk, singing along with the rad - In her pool, at night, staring at us JAMES’S DAYDREAMING is broken by Frigo, who stands over him:
Don’t fall asleep, Brennan.
Why?
Cause I’ll jack off on your face. Frigo giggles like a lunatic.
What on earth is wrong with you? James stands up. He’s come to a decision:
Look, can you get your mom’s car again? Right now? I’11l give you twenty bucks.
Thirty.
Fine.
Forty. James shakes his head. He gets out his wallet, removes tw twenties and hands them over.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 120. 173 174 175
As Frigo goes to pocket the cash, James slugs him in the privates. Frigo collapses onto the grass.
(as he walks off) Even. EXT. FRIGO’S HOUSE - NIGHT 174 Once again, Frigo is behind the wheel of his mother’s Cut as James pushes the car out of the driveway.
The Cutlass rumbles down a street. As they approach Em's house, they see that there are a few cars in the driveway several more parked on the street.
Huh. Frigo stops the car.
I’1l wait for you.
No, don’t. Beat. Frigo looks sympathetically at James.
Hope it works out.

(surprised & a little touched) Thanks, Frigo. James, surprised and a little touched by Frigo, gets out the car and crosses toward the front door. He rings the bell. He turns back toward Frigo. He’s not in the car -- instead, he’s over on the side of Em’s lawn, urinating on tree.
I can’t hold it! James hears the door open and turns back. Em stands there Behind her we can hear an adult cocktail party in progres Em stares at James, tongue-tied.
Hey, I wanted to talk to you. My timing sucks as usual.  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 121. 175 176 177
Um. Come in. Hurry. She ushers him inside.

Em leads James past the living room, where oblivious adul are clustered, talking loudly. They hurry up the stairs. INT. EM’S BEDROOM, LEWIN HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 177 James enters the room. Em follows, shutting the door. The look at each other for an awkward beat.
This is pretty weird.

Yeah. (beat) Look. I’m here to apologize. First of all, I’m sorry I hung up on you that day. Worse, it’s my fault everyone found out about you and Connell. I told Lisa P. And...while you and I were seeing each other...I went on a date with Lisa P. Nothing really happened. We kissed a little. But I...I don’t know...I feel bad about that.
I heard you guys went out.
You did? You never said anything.
(looking down) What could I say? (beat) I’m sorry if I hurt you. I...I don’t know what’s wrong with me. Beat.
The only thing wrong is that you need to find someone you can trust. She looks up at him for a long beat.
Are you nominating yourself?  ADVENTURELAND (revised 8/5/07) 122. 177 178

As long as you don’t mind trusting a guy who clearly doesn’t have a fucking clue about anything. Em moves to James. She pulls his shirt off. He leans forward and kisses her. Without abandoning her lips, he slides off her t-shirt. They kick off their shoes, pull o socks, then help each other out of their pants. Em takes her bra. They both slide off their underwear. They stand facing each other, naked. Their eyes are nervo and searching. James caresses her cheek and smiles. Em laughs, blinking away a few tears. We hold on them for a long moment.
It’s right after sunup. Nobody is here yet.

The empty midway; a rusty cotton candy vending cart; the snack bar menu sign that hasn’t changed for years and is missing letters; the dark and silent video arcade; the “B the Clown” machine, with an “OUT OF ORDER” sign; the moronically grinning “Hats Off To Larry” mannequin; racks stuffed “bananas with eyes”; empty Chopper ride gondolas, creaking and swaying... WE END ON A SHOT THAT CRANES INTO THE AIR, showing a wide view of the shabby little park. A desolate wind blows through Adventureland. Another summer's almost over. END CREDITS OVER “Ever Fallen In Love” by The Buzzcocks.
